ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Highly recommended, even to those with previous experience in studying similar materials. If you have such a background, I think you will learn much through doing homework. There are also some advanced topics in this course.
This course provides a great foundation for all econ courses.
Yes I will recommend to all students interested in economics. (not only econometrics)
Absolutely critical for anyone who is looking to do empirical research
Yes. I would highly recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel like I could fill the gaps in my knowledge in econometrics thorough this course.

Don explained everything so well. I am able to grasp essence of metrics and understand all reasonings behind theories. It definitely deepened my understanding of economics/metrics. My future research highly likely will be related to metrics.

As a future archival researcher, this course was critical for understanding the theory underlying empirical research methods. Although I would have liked for the course to sacrifice some of the theoretical approach in favor of practical applications, I believe that knowing the theory will help.
Very helpful. Required by the program.

I don't have the math background in the materials of course. My research interests are applied econometric analysis. I think the course prepare me really well with understanding research in the field of econometrics and its techniques, which is incredible tool to have for my own research.
